oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 12 lb. artillery shell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Found at Bulls Gap, Tenn., possibly from one of the engagements at that place. Bulls Gap witnessed a surprising amount of military action during the Civil War. A Union cavalry force under Gen. Alvan Cullem Gillem camped there September 3, 1864. The next day troopers cornered and killed Gen. John Hunt Morgan in Greeneville, Tenn. A small battle was fought at Bulls Gap November 11-13, 1864 between Gillem's men and Confederates under Gen. John C. Breckenridge. The Confederates forced a Union withdrawal.
